actions.text: Introduced in the Senate, read twice, considered, read the third time, and passed without amendment by Voice Vote.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.

actions.committee: House Committee on Education and Labor
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and Labor.
Committee on Education and Labor discharged.
Mr. Ford (MI) asked unanimous consent to discharge from committee and consider.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: A bill to make certain technical amendments to the National and Community Service Act, and for other purposes.
popular_title: National & Community Service Technical Amendment bill
short_title: National and Community Service Technical Amendments Act of 1991

summary.text: National and Community Service Technical Amendments Act of 1991 - Amends the National and Community Service Act to make various technical amendments, including revisions of definitions and of programs for students and out-of-school students, Serve-America, American Conservation and Youth Service Corps, participant eligibility and post-service benefits, innovative and demonstration programs and projects, Youthbuild, administration, and the Commission on National and Community Service. Directs the Commission on National and Community Service to issue final rules or regulations to implement title I of such Act within 180 days after its enactment. Requires, to the maximum extent practicable, that an effort be made to appoint members of the Board of Directors of such Commission who: (1) have extensive experience in volunteer and service opportunity programs; (2) represent a broad range of viewpoints; and (3) will give the Board diversity of race, ethnicity, age, gender, and political party membership.

titles.title: National & Community Service Technical Amendment bill
National and Community Service Technical Amendments Act of 1991
National and Community Service Technical Amendments Act of 1991
